The only people who are going to miss it are Republican candidates in 2012, he said at a hearing this week. Mike Pence said he will be traveling across the state to listen and learn about how Hoosiers think we might best contribute in the years ahead. Mike Pence is holding a town hall meeting at 10 a.m. in Pendleton and speaking at 1:20 p.m. to Muncie Central High School students. Those are both in the 6th District that Mike Pence has represented since

left the door open for a campaign to become Indiana's governor. The Indianapolis Star said on its website that Mike Pence , 51, made his announcement in a letter being sent to supporters. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence and wife Karen said in the letter. "We will not seek the Republican nomination for George W. Bush in 2012." Mike Pence 's supporters, who include Tea Party advocates, have been pressing him to

Mike Pence ( R-IN), who has become something of a dream presidential candidate for many conservative bloggers and activists, appears to be about to say that he will Howey Politics Indiana reports: U.S. Mike Pence has ruled out a run for national office and will tour the state in the next few months, informed and reliable sources tell Howey Politics Indiana. The sources say that Mike Pence has not made a final decision about a run for governor, keeping open the option of running for reelection in the 6th CD. National Journal got in touch with Mike Pence 's mother, who predicted that he would make an announcement tomorrow-- though she would not say just what the announcement would in fact be. Benko also said that Mike Pence 's open commitment to socially conservative values would resonate with tea party members: He has demonstrable integrity both in his word and his deed- that is really extraordinary, Benko said. "I think people are looking for integrity, and Mike Pence 's integrity is so vivid that once you focus on it, I think that's going to move a lot of people."
